meanings.definition: Subjected to physical or moral force
meanings.sent1: The pressured student felt overwhelmed by the strict teacher's demands.
meanings.sent2: She looked pressured as she tried to lift the heavy box.
meanings.sent3: The pressured cat reluctantly allowed the vet to examine its paw.
meanings.sent4: The pressured dam finally gave way under the relentless rain.
meanings.sent5: The pressured balloon burst with a loud pop, startling everyone nearby.

meanings.sent1: The coach pressured the team to give their best performance in the upcoming match.
meanings.sent2: She pressured him to finish his homework before going out to play.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel pressured the bird to share its nuts in exchange for shiny pebbles.
meanings.sent4: The deadline pressured him to complete the project ahead of schedule.
meanings.sent5: The teacher pressured the students to participate actively in the class discussion.

meanings.sent1: The pressured worker struggled to meet the tight deadline.
meanings.sent2: He looked pressured as he tried to balance work and family responsibilities.
meanings.sent3: The pressured chef accidentally added salt instead of sugar to the cake batter.
meanings.sent4: The pressured athlete pushed through the pain to reach the finish line.
meanings.sent5: The pressured student's heart raced as the exam time approached.
